thread.title: Asciano board approves $12b takeover.

title: Asciano board approves $12b takeover.
text:
Tue, Aug 18, 2015, 8:31 AM AEST - Australia Markets open in 1 hr 29 mins Asciano board approves $12b takeover. AAP – 9 minutes ago Print 
Australia's largest rail and freight operator Asciano has agreed to a $12 billion takeover by Canada's Brookfield Infrastructure Group. 
Asciano's board of directors have backed an increased offer from Brookfield that will see shareholders receive the equivalent of $9.15 for every share they own, to be paid in a combination of cash and Brookfield shares. 
Meanwhile, Asciano, which owns the Pacific National rail business and Patrick ports business, announced it has lifted its full-year profit 41 per cent to $359.6 million. @y7finance on Twitter, become a fan on Facebook Shell gets go ahead for Arctic drilling AAP 
The federal government has given Royal Dutch Shell the final permit it needs to drill for oil in the Arctic Ocean … Terms
